description: From Latin intumēscēns, present participle of intumescō (“rise, swell”), from tumescō (“become inflated”).

adjectives.description: intumescent (comparative more intumescent, superlative most intumescent)

entries.meaning: That becomes swollen, especially upon exposure to heat
Any substance that swells on exposure to heat, thus increasing in volume and decreasing in density.
examples: Intumescents are used in some fire protection systems.
